title: [Psychology] Politicization of the COVID-19 pandemic had a powerful influence over why people did, or did not, comply with social distancing guidelines during the lockdown days, a new study found. The analysis boiled down to whom study participants trusted most: scientists or President Donald Trump.

[Psychology] Cross-sectional study found a 30.2% prevalence of PTSD after acute COVID-19 infection. This is in line with findings in survivors of previous coronavirus illnesses, compared with findings reported after other types of collective traumatic events.
